name: 1970s TV
description: The 1970s was a thrilling time in Australian television as productions expanded in scale, scope, and ambition.

key_work.title: 1970s Australian TV miniature
key_work.credit_line: Designed by Graham McGuffie, Emily Boutard and Megafun
key_work.brief_description: This gorgeous model miniature celebrates the screen stories Australians loved during the 1970s.

constellations_primary.name: 1970s TV
constellations_primary.description: The 1970s was a thrilling time in Australian television as productions expanded in scale, scope, and ambition.

end.title: Number 96
end.brief_description: Number 96 was a popular soap set in a Sydney apartment block. Cash Harmon Television produced the series for Network Ten, which requested a Coronation Street-type serial, and specifically one that explored adult subjects.

constellations_other.name: 1970s TV
constellations_other.description: The 1970s was a thrilling time in Australian television as productions expanded in scale, scope, and ambition.

constellations_other.name: Page to screen
constellations_other.description: Australian scribes and screenwriters unite on the silver and small screens.

constellations_other.name: Gender transcending larrikins
constellations_other.description: Australia has a long history with gender creativity and drag culture, both on screen and on stage.

links.description: With more structures to support the local industry, Australian productions started to push the boundaries in the 70s, particularly the adults-only Number 96, which featured saucy storylines, satirical humour, and scandalous nudity.

start.title: Countdown
start.brief_description: Countdown was a long-running popular weekly Australian music television show broadcast by the ABC from 8 November 1974 until 19 July 1987.

constellations_other.name: 1970s TV
constellations_other.description: The 1970s was a thrilling time in Australian television as productions expanded in scale, scope, and ambition.

constellations_other.name: The secret life of suburbia and music videos
constellations_other.description: Australia's famous streets and suburbs have defined music videos, TV shows and miniseries, providing a unique backdrop to Australian stories and music.

end.title: The Sullivans
end.brief_description: The Sullivans told the story of an average middle-class Melbourne family and the effect World War II had on their lives.

constellations_other.name: 1970s TV
constellations_other.description: The 1970s was a thrilling time in Australian television as productions expanded in scale, scope, and ambition.

links.description: For 13 years Countdown featured live performances from local and overseas acts, not to mention helping launch the careers of the likes of Skyhooks, Kylie Minogue, AC/DC and INXS. Minogue got her start on TV in the 70s with The Sullivans.

start.title: 20,000 Days on Earth
start.brief_description: A semi-fictionalized documentary about a day in the life of Australian musician Nick Cave’s persona.

constellations_other.name: 1970s TV
constellations_other.description: The 1970s was a thrilling time in Australian television as productions expanded in scale, scope, and ambition.

end.title: SBS World News (1980)
end.brief_description: SBS World News was one of public broadcaster SBS’s first programs.

constellations_other.name: 1970s TV
constellations_other.description: The 1970s was a thrilling time in Australian television as productions expanded in scale, scope, and ambition.

links.description: 20,000 Days on Earth, which is a blend of doco and feature. Cave has worked in film throughout his career, which started in 1979 - the same year SBS launched, with SBS World News following just after.

start.title: Number 96
start.brief_description: Number 96 was a popular soap set in a Sydney apartment block. Cash Harmon Television produced the series for Network Ten, which requested a Coronation Street-type serial, and specifically one that explored adult subjects.

constellations_other.description: The 1970s was a thrilling time in Australian television as productions expanded in scale, scope, and ambition.

constellations_other.name: Page to screen
constellations_other.description: Australian scribes and screenwriters unite on the silver and small screens.

constellations_other.name: Gender transcending larrikins
constellations_other.description: Australia has a long history with gender creativity and drag culture, both on screen and on stage.

end.title: Countdown
end.brief_description: Countdown was a long-running popular weekly Australian music television show broadcast by the ABC from 8 November 1974 until 19 July 1987.

constellations_other.name: 1970s TV
constellations_other.description: The 1970s was a thrilling time in Australian television as productions expanded in scale, scope, and ambition.

constellations_other.name: The secret life of suburbia and music videos
constellations_other.description: Australia's famous streets and suburbs have defined music videos, TV shows and miniseries, providing a unique backdrop to Australian stories and music.

links.description: Number 96 was one of the first Aussie shows to tackle themes like sex, adultery, racism, drug use, homosexuality, and more. Meanwhile on ABC, Countdown became essential for anyone wanting to be ‘cool’ as Ian ‘Molly’ Meldrum covered the latest music news.

start.title: The Sullivans
start.brief_description: The Sullivans told the story of an average middle-class Melbourne family and the effect World War II had on their lives.

end.brief_description: A semi-fictionalized documentary about a day in the life of Australian musician Nick Cave’s persona.

constellations_other.name: 1970s TV
constellations_other.description: The 1970s was a thrilling time in Australian television as productions expanded in scale, scope, and ambition.

links.description: Kylie would later go on to star in more popular Australian soap Neighbours and many films over her career, including her friend and frequent collaborator Nick Cave’s 20,000 Days on Earth.

start.title: SBS World News (1980)
start.brief_description: SBS World News was one of public broadcaster SBS’s first programs.

end.title: The Feed (2013 - present)
end.brief_description: The Feed is a nightly news, current affairs and comedy program.

constellations_other.name: 1970s TV
constellations_other.description: The 1970s was a thrilling time in Australian television as productions expanded in scale, scope, and ambition.

links.description: With SBS World News, public broadcaster SBS was founded with the aim of servicing and highlighting multicultural Australia. The Feed was a twist on the news programming the station is known for, with a cast of presenters and producers covering stories relevant to younger Australians.

start.title: The Feed (2013 - present)
start.brief_description: The Feed is a nightly news, current affairs and comedy program.

constellations_other.name: 1970s TV
constellations_other.description: The 1970s was a thrilling time in Australian television as productions expanded in scale, scope, and ambition.

end.title: Sunshine
end.creator_credit: Daina Reid, Ian Collie, Lisa Cox and Rachael Turk
end.brief_description: The story of Sunshine follows the life of Jacob, a young, aspiring South Sudanese-Australian basketball player who is on the cusp of being picked up by US scouts for the US College league.

constellations_other.name: 1970s TV
constellations_other.description: The 1970s was a thrilling time in Australian television as productions expanded in scale, scope, and ambition.

constellations_other.name: Landscape as character
constellations_other.description: The landscape is often a character in Australian films. Usually, it's a villain that represents our problematic national character and is increasingly used to challenge our troubled history and explore our evolving identities.

links.description: The Feed was part of a new wave of SBS programming that included scripted series such as The Family Law and Sunshine, which was set within the South-Sudanese Australian community.
